glossdef.p: Overworked as a term of vague approval and (with not) of disapproval. Strictly applicable only to actions: “Is it worth while to telegraph?”

row.entry: His books are not worth while.
His books are not worth reading (are not worth one's while to read; do not repay reading; are worthless).

glossdef.p: The use of worth while before a noun (“a worth while story”) is indefensible.
